intro: Erysimum koelzii, commonly known as the Koelz's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Chile. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and also hairy. Its flowers are bright yellow, with four petals and numerous stamens, forming a showy inflorescence. Erysimum koelzii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
